title: Website Not Reloading Properly in Firefox - "The Page Isn’t Redirecting Properly" Error
content:
Hello new here, I’ve been facing a frustrating issue with my website on Firefox, and I’m unable to find a solution despite searching for hours. My website, https://snakeaimtool.pro/, sometimes fails to reload and displays the error: "The page isn’t redirecting properly."

I contacted my hosting support, and they confirmed that there’s no issue with the server. Everything is working fine on their end.

I realized the issue might be specific to Firefox because I primarily use Firefox and don’t face this problem on other browsers like Chrome.

I’ve been searching for solutions on YouTube and other forums, but nothing has worked so far. Could someone please suggest a possible solution or guide me on how to resolve this issue? Thank you in advance for your help, I attached the issue image!

title: All external links open in the same tab.
content:
I want links that I open (in Firefox, from Firefox, like opening any normal link) to open in the same tab (unless otherwise specific, like a normal browser should work), and all links from other applications to open in a new tab.

Whenever I click a link, it overrides my current tab, even if I'm working on something important. Apps do not always make it obvious what might be a URL. Windows for instance LOVES to open up "support" links in your browser. Firefox also does this itself with its update function, it opens up its update notification by overwriting your previous tab.

This is a really, really basic feature that should really be a default setting, but it doesn't seem to exist in settings at all.
